page.title: 16Traffic in Sandwich
page.content: The town of Sandwich still retains its Mediaeval street pattern. The two main route ways, Thanet to Deal, and Canterbury to Sandwich, still meet in the town centre causing severe traffic congestion, noise and pollution in the narrow streets. A badly needed by-pass, north-south was completed in 1980 which has reduced the traffic congestion in the town considerably. Until the completion of this by-pass nearly 75% of all traffic was just passing through. The congestion was further confused by the presence of a toll bridge to the north of Sandwich over the River Stour. The toll was 5p for cars. This toll was brought to an end when , in 1974, Sandwich lost its Borough Council status to Dover. However over the years the toll had paid for the extension to the Guildhall which was opened in 1973.
